title: Astro is joining Cloudflare
summary:
**AI-Generated Summary**: This is an automated summary of a Cloudflare blog post created using AI. For the full details and context, please read the original post.

**Cloudflare Acquires Astro, a Popular Web Framework**

Cloudflare has announced its acquisition of Astro, a web framework for building fast, content-driven websites. Astro is used by a wide range of developers and companies, including established brands like Porsche and IKEA, as well as fast-growing AI companies like OpenAI. By joining forces with the Astro team, Cloudflare aims to make Astro the best framework for content-driven websites for years to come.

**Key Technical Details**

The acquisition includes the Astro 6 release, which features a redesigned development server powered by Vite. The first public beta release of Astro 6 is now available, with a general availability (GA) release coming in the weeks ahead. Astro will remain open source, MIT-licensed, and open to contributions, with a public roadmap and open governance.

**Practical Implications for Developers**

Developers will continue to use Astro as they do today, with no changes to its core functionality. Astro's Islands Architecture, which allows for fast, static HTML and client-side rendering, will remain a key part of the framework. Cloudflare has committed to supporting Astro developers everywhere, and the acquisition will not affect Astro's portability across clouds and platforms.

**Why Choose Astro?**

Astro's success can be attributed to its focus on five design principles: content-driven, server-first, fast by default, easy to use, and developer-focused. These principles have allowed Astro to grow rapidly and become a popular choice among developers building content-driven websites.
